repnme.cdata!:
Serbia - Consolidated Collection and
            Pension Administration Reform Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Consolidated Collection
            and Pension Administration Reform Project for Serbia were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was high, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the
            project provides a set of lessons for future operations,
            both in terms of design features and implementation
            arrangements. In terms of design, it is important to
            understand the tax administration aspects of a pension
            administration reform involving collection related issues.
            Relevant tax administration expertise needs to be brought on
            board from the early phases of project preparation and
            maintained throughout implementation. It is equally
            important to involve the tax office early on, not only
            because of their mandated role, but they also tend to be the
            strongest institution in terms of human and technical
            capacity, legal instruments of enforcement at their disposal
            and political support. It is also important to ensure
            through design features and implementation arrangements that
            the tax administration is made interested in the success of
            the project and the reform it supports. A stakeholder
            analysis of the participating institutions is crucial in
            order to identify potential reasons for support and
            resistance, the areas where cooperation is natural and where
            it needs more attention from high level officials in a
            position to resolve institutional problems. In the case of
            projects with technically complex components where various
            approaches may exist, it is critical to agree with the
            client on the approach, institutional and broad technical
            solution to be pursued. Effective supervision, based on an
            understanding of the clients objectives and constraints is
            crucial and can help overcome and offset problems inherent
            in the design or country circumstances.

repnme.cdata!:
Serbia - Consolidation of Collection and
            Pension Administration Reform Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Consolidation of Collection and Pension Administration
            Reform Project for Serbia will be to improve the
            effectiveness and efficiency of the pension system through
            the modernization and streamlining of the institutional
            capacity in the pension system, improved pension system
            administration, developed capacity for policy
            identification, analysis and monitoring and increased public
            understanding of the system. The credit in the amount of SDR
            16.6 million was approved by the Board of Directors in May,
            2005. It aims to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of
            the pension system through: the modernization and
            streamlining of the institutional capacity in the pension
            system; improved pension system administration; developed
            capacity for policy identification, analysis and monitoring;
            and increased public understanding of the system. There were
            three components: consolidation of collection and reporting;
            consolidation and institutional strengthening of the
            Pay-as-you-go (PAYGO) funds; and pension policy analysis and development.

Serbia - Consolidation of
            Collection and Pension Administration Reform Project :
            restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet

repnme.cdata!:
Serbia - Consolidation of Collection and
            Pension Administration Reform Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Consolidation of
            Collection and Pension Administration Reform Project for
            Serbia will be to improve the effectiveness and efficiency
            of the pension system through the modernization and
            streamlining of the institutional capacity in the pension
            system, improved pension system administration, developed
            capacity for policy identification, analysis and monitoring
            and increased public understanding of the system. From the
            time of its effectiveness in June 2005, the project has
            suffered implementation delays as a result of political
            instability and frequent changes in government. Both the
            project development objective rating and its Implementation
            progress rating are moderately satisfactory. It is the
            Bank's assessment that an 18 month extension will be
            prudent to ensure the completion of the development of the
            majority of the software solutions for the business
            processes, services and procurement of hardware for the
            central registry. The Government is, however, optimistic
            that the work can be finalized within 12 months and has
            objected to a longer extension at this time. Thus, this
            request is for a 12 month extension only. The Government has
            prepared a detailed action plan for the completion of the
            remaining project activities reflecting the one year
            extension. The action plan is found acceptable to the Bank.
            Should the completion of this project activity exceed the
            requested one year extension of the closing date, the
            Government has committed to financing remaining activities
            from its own resources. Alternatively, in such case, the
            Government could request another short extension and the
            World Bank team will be amenable to considering such a
            request. There are no outstanding audit reports for this
            project and the financial management rating is satisfactory.
            This will be the first extension of the project closing date.

repnme.cdata!:
Serbia - Consolidated Collection and
            Pension Administration Reform Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Consolidated Collection and Pension Administration Reform
            Project for Serbia will be to improve the effectiveness and
            efficiency of the pension system through the modernization
            and streamlining of the institutional capacity in the
            pension system, improved pension system administration, dev
            eloped capacity for policy identification, analysis and
            monitoring and increased public understanding of the system.
            The change is to establish a new consolidated disbursement
            category for all expenditures under the project instead of
            separate categories for different types of expenditures,
            category (five) goods, consultant services, including
            auditing services, training and incremental operating costs,
            detailed in part b, disbursement arrangements. The change
            will simplify disbursement arrangements in order to allow
            the Government of Serbia to expedite implementation of
            project activities, allow for regularization of the current
            overdraft in consultant's services, as well as provide
            the Borrower with important flexibility in designing and
            procuring a combination of software and hardware to achieve
            the project objectives.
